summary: Georgian is a language spoken by about 3.8 million people, mainly in Georgia. It's written in a unique script and is the country's official language. Georgian is related to other Kartvelian languages like Megrelian and Laz. It has a complex consonant system and five vowels. The language uses an agglutinative structure, meaning words are formed by adding different elements. Georgian doesn't have grammatical gender and uses postpositions instead of prepositions. Over time, its writing system has evolved, and today, the Mkhedruli script is most commonly used.
title: Georgian language
